Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition:
Sweaty \Sweat"y\, a. [Compar. {Sweatier}; superl. {Sweatiest}.] 1. Moist with sweat; as, a sweaty skin; a sweaty garment. [1913 Webster]
2. Consisting of sweat; of the nature of sweat. [1913 Webster]
No noisome whiffs or sweaty streams. --Swift. [1913 Webster]
3. Causing sweat; hence, laborious; toilsome; difficult. ``The sweaty forge.'' --Prior. [1913 Webster]
sweaty adj : being wet with perspiration; "the perspiring runners"; "his sweating face"; "sweaty clothes" [syn: {perspiring}, {sweating}] [also: {sweatiest}, {sweatier}]
